alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Clay; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 9:48AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Nicholas, southwestern Braxton, west central Webster and northeastern Clay Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 948 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Big Otter, or 10 miles west of Sutton, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Camden-On-gauley, Birch River, Craigsville, Camden On Gauley, Harrison, Cowen, Widen, Frametown, Strange Creek, Wilsie, Canvas, Servia, Muddlety, Upper Glade, Boggs, Little Birch, and Calvin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 40 and 58. Route 19 between mile markers 41 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
